## Summary of Changes Hello @ApprenticeGC, I'm Gemini Code Assist[^1]! I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed! This pull request establishes the initial infrastructure and documentation for a custom CJK monospace font pipeline. It defines how specialized angle glyphs will be integrated into the Unicode Private Use Area (PUA) of a base font (Sarasa Gothic), provides scripts for automated font patching, and outlines the CI/CD process for building and distributing these fonts. Additionally, it includes comprehensive documentation for integrating and configuring the custom font within the Rio Terminal environment, ensuring a consistent and reproducible development and distribution experience. ### Highlights * **Font Pipeline Groundwork**: Introduced the foundational elements for a custom font pipeline, including scripts and documentation for generating and patching fonts. * **RFCs for Font Strategy**: Three new RFCs (RFC-020, RFC-021, RFC-022) were added, detailing the font pipeline, PUA layout, Rio integration, and CI/CD strategy for font building and distribution. * **PUA Layout & SVG Specification**: Defined the Unicode Private Use Area (PUA) allocation for 36 angle glyphs and provided detailed SVG specifications for their consistent creation, ensuring visual connectivity across cells. * **Automated Build Scripts & Tasks**: Added Python scripts (`generate_angle_svgs.py`, `patch_sarasa.py`) and `Taskfile` entries to automate SVG generation, font patching (using FontForge), and the creation of a development bundle. * **Rio Terminal Integration Documentation**: Comprehensive documentation was added for integrating the custom font with Rio Terminal, covering bundle layout, configuration, and troubleshooting for both development and distribution.
